intro: Coprosma sinensis, commonly known as Chinese coprosma, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rubiaceae. It is native to China and is characterized by its small, oval-shaped leaves that are typically glossy and dark green. The plant produces clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in summer, followed by bright red or orange berries. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and seasonal color changes. Coprosma sinensis is relatively low maintenance and thrives in well-drained soil and partial to full sun.
